instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power but no boot with trackpad plugged in
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage, <CAPACITOR>C5125</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R5489</RESISTOR> were corroded so I replaced them and it turns on now, however once I plug the trackpad in it chimes then gets stuck at a blank black screen before the Apple logo. Already tried a known good trackpad and cable, and the trackpad does click when it is on. Ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power but no boot with trackpad plugged in
threads.message: Disconnect keyboard and try again. Checked J4802 for corrosion?
